content: Write an ode about forests using exactly 70 words.

Forests vast, where ancient trees do stand,
Guardians of the earth, with branches wide and grand.
Whispers of the wind through leaves so green,
A symphony of life, where nature's secrets convene.

Mystic realms where sunlight gently beams,
Dappled shadows dance, in emerald dreams.
Home to creatures, from high to low,
In this verdant world, their stories flow.

Timeless sentinels, through seasons' sway,
They breathe and grow, in silent array.
Oh, forests deep, your beauty never fades,
A sanctuary where the wild stillades.
